subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Licensing for Jerome and Ghoti fonts
msgSnippet: Hi Wonder, Fonts are made with software. There are several programs available to do it. I use one called Font Creator Program or FCP. I say I ve used it. It s
messageBody:
Hi Wonder,

 

Fonts are made with software. There are several programs available to do it. I use one called Font Creator Program or FCP. I say I’ve used it. It’s more like I’ve tried it. It works but it seems a bit cumbersome. It has the advantage of costing a few tens of dollars. There may be some other programs out there that are expensive, but the others I know about are several hundreds of dollars. The address of FCP is www.high-logic.com.

 

I use the Read alphabet to keep a journal. Unfortunately, I’m unaware of a dictionary for the Read Alphabet. However, it is completely phonetic so in principle you can pick any dictionary that spells words phonetically and use it to spell using the Read alphabet. However, this is a bit cumbersome. Also, there is disagreement among dictionaries about how words are pronounced. Some who use the Read alphabet are not too concerned about this and maintain these relative differences in spelling are not important. I tend to agree, but even if true, I sometimes find it difficult to spell the words without fairly major errors. So I think a dictionary would be nice for beginners. It would be a good project to draft one.

 

I’m not sure I understood your questions regarding punctuation. I can’t quite imagine connecting a period to the letters in a pleasing way.

 

Good Wishes,

 

 

 

e-mail: ed.gaddy@...

phone:  301 390 5115

 

-----Original Message-----
From: wonder_roast [mailto:Roasted_Beanie@...]
Sent: Saturday, August 03, 2002 2:23 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Licensing for Jerome and Ghoti fonts

 

I would probably use the font you make, if it looks nice and such. 
Also, I was wondering, how do you make fonts?  I have plenty of fonts
I'd like to make (not really of the Read Alphabet tho).

Also, I'd like to ask anyone who reads this to kindly READ and REPLY
to the messages I'd posted about a month ago.  In short, these were I
my messages:

1) How do each of you use the Read Alphabet personally?

2) Is there a dictionary of any sort for spellings in the Read
Alphabet?  How do you know if you're spelling words right?  I've
noticed some misspellings in posts, and I wonder about that.  Also,
what about punctuation?  Wouldn't one think that punctuation that
would connect to the letters would fit better, as well as numbers
that connect?

Please reply this time, thank you.
